Name and Date. impress Letter Lo. I 1 *225-1^1/53 dated 9tii September r953 from tne Government of in^ia* Subject. xie^uest f rom tne ■‘■eraian Governrnexit for tne service of a judicial notice on a resident of muscat— ^a^Ler Abdul matif.CONFIDENTIAL. r r in No. 1335-a of 1933. The Hon’hle the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf presents his com pliments to 1‘ttQ rolltical A^eat, m u a c a. t, and has the honour to transmit to him a copy of the undermentioned docu ment ^ for ioforjuation. British Consulate-General,#' P.Z. 6171/33. Sir » INDIA OFFICE, WHITEHALL, LONDON, S.W.l. 4th. October 1933. With reference to Foreign Office letter No.T. 9150/9150/371 of 26th September 1933 on the subject of a request from the Persian Government for the service of a judicial document upon Bagher Abdul Latif, a <\ resident in Muscat, I am directed by the Secretary of State for India to refer to India Office printed letters Nos.P.Z.5918/33 of 20th September and P.Z.5933/33 of 21st September 1933, transmitting copies of correspondence on the subject received from the Government of India and the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. In the light of the Government of India’s views Sir Samuel Hoare agrees that the Persian Government or the Persian Charge d’Affaires in London should be informed that until ^ relations between Persia and Muscat have been regularised it will not be possible for His Majesty’s Government to assist in securing the service in Muscat of any notice or documents emanating fran the Persian Courts. I am, Sir, Your obedient Servant, % ) J. 0. WALTON. The Under Secretary of State, Foreign Office, S.W.l.—

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 6/9 Foreign Interests: Persian Government's Request for Services of Judicial Notices on Muscatis'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 15; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 3-14; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between British officials concerning requests made by the Persian Government to serve judicial notices on Muscat residents as a result of legal proceedings in Persian courts.
